meanings.definition: The stem or stalk of a plant, especially of a cereal grain.
meanings.sent1: The farmer gathered the culm of the wheat to use for thatching the roof.
meanings.sent2: The culm of the corn swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The culm of the rice plant told the other plants jokes to make them grow taller.
meanings.sent4: The culm of the sunflower reached for the sky, eager to touch the clouds.
meanings.sent5: The culm of the sugar cane stood tall and proud in the field.

meanings.definition: Coal dust or slack left after the screening of coal.
meanings.sent1: The miners cleared away the culm to reveal the shiny coal underneath.
meanings.sent2: The culm from the coal mine was used to fill in the old quarry.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous culm from the coal pile played hide and seek with the workers.
meanings.sent4: The culm in the air settled like a dark cloud over the mining town.
meanings.sent5: The children made sculptures out of the culm left behind by the miners.
